info.name: Elf Backgrounds
info.description: Elf Backgrounds from The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

element.name: The Call of the Sea
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: No Elf could live by the Sea and not be moved by it. The crashing of waves is a second heartbeat to you; but you do not want to depart Middle-earth yet, for you feel that you have some purpose to fulfil before you sail away. You are not certain what lies in your future, but you are committed to finding out.
Tool Proficiency: A musical instrument of your choice

select.name: Musical Instrument (The Call of the Sea)

element.name: Maker of Ships
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: You studied your chosen craft under the expert shipbuilders of CÃ­rdan; but though the long firth of Lune stirs your heart, you feel the world is wide, and you have lived your life on its edge. Perhaps it is time to go where no ship can take you...

element.name: A Merchant Family
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Elven ships still sometimes sail to Dol Amroth and Pelargir to trade with the Men of Gondor. You have traded with mortal folk for years, but the Corsairs of Umbar grow more numerous and the lords of Gondor more cautious. Now ships seldom sail south, and you have decided to travel elsewhere.

element.name: Sky-Watchers
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: When aboard ship, you study the skies and predict the weather. With much practice, you became adept at this, and can detect a storm brewing hundreds of miles away. Now, when you are at home in the Havens, you notice strange movements in the air coming from the south-east, where lies Mordor, the Land of Shadows.

element.name: Tower Guard
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Your folk guards the Tower Hills, lest the Enemy benefit from great secrets hidden there. Sometimes, you have been tasked with keeping the boldest of the little folk away from the towers, and by Mithrandir's advice, you keep a secret watch on their border. You know not what destiny these Hobbits have, but a fondness for them grows in your heart.

element.name: Vistor to the Mountains
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Not content to stay in your homeland, you were drawn to the Blue Mountains and its folk. Most Dwarves want nothing to do with an overcurious Elf, but a few taught you enough for you to appreciate their skills and love for beautiful objects. You wonder what you could learn in other lands, and now prepare for a longer journey.
Tool Proficiency: Jeweler's tools or smith's tools

setters.set: Insight, Old Lore, Jeweler's Tools/Smith's Tools
